name: Manfred Huber
content: Manfred Huber's Home Page Manfred Huber Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of Texas at Arlington Research Interests: My main research interests are in Autonomous Robot Systems, Sensor-driven Robotics, Machine Learning, and the Development of Intelligent Behavior. (outdated) CV Publications Teaching: Spring 2021: Unmanned Vehicle System Development (CSE 4379 / CSE 5384) Machine Learning (CSE 6363) Other Courses: Discrete Structures (CSE 2315) Theoretical Concepts (CSE 3315) Artificial Intelligence I (CSE 4308 / CSE 5360) Senior Design I (CSE 4316) Senior Design II (CSE 4317) Computational Methods (CSE 4345 / CSE 5315) Autonomous Robots (CSE 4360 / CSE 5364) Introduction to Unmanned Vehicle Systems (CSE 4378 / CSE 5383) Smart Home Technologies (CSE 4392 / CSE 5392) Artificial Intelligence I (CSE 4308 / CSE 5360) Data Modeling & Analysis Techniques (CSE 5301) Artificial Intelligence II (CSE 4309 / CSE 5361) Multiagent Systems (CSE 6369) Reinforcement Learning (CSE 6369) Reasoning with Uncertainty for Data Interpretation, Modeling, and Decision Making (CSE 6369) Conference and Journal Deadlines in AI and Robotics But not everything is business... If you want you can visit my hometown Lahr, which is a town in the Black Forest in Germany. (There are a couple of English pages but most pages are in German) I like to play volleyball and soccer and to keep up with the newest results try to follow the german Bundesliga. And I used to organize (and of course run in) the annual LPR Half Marathon. And lots more to come ... Manfred Huber Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of Texas at Arlington Box 19015, Arlington, TX 76019-0015 email: huber@cse.uta.edu
